IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent Class Reference

Class for performing all client/server communication with Ionic.com. More...

 Agent ()
 Initializes the object to be empty.
 
 Agent (Agent ^ agent)
 Initializes an agent as a copy of another agent. Copying an agent saves time, since otherwise the agent has to reload the device profiles from disk. Having multiple agents allows you to do key operations on multiple threads. More...

Detailed Description

Class for performing all client/server communication with Ionic.com.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Agent()

IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::Agent ( Agent ^  agent)

Initializes an agent as a copy of another agent. Copying an agent saves time, since otherwise the agent has to reload the device profiles from disk. Having multiple agents allows you to do key operations on multiple threads.

Parameters
[in]agentThe agent to copy.

◆ CreateDevice()

CreateDeviceResponse IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::CreateDevice ( CreateDeviceRequest^  deviceRequest)

Creates (registers) a device with Ionic.com.

This method makes an HTTP call to Ionic.com to register a device. Throws an Exception on failure.

Parameters
[in]deviceRequestThe registration input data object.
Returns
A registration output data object.

◆ CreateIdentityAssertion()

CreateIdentityAssertionResponse IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::CreateIdentityAssertion ( CreateIdentityAssertionRequest^  assertionRequest)

Creates an identity assertion issued by an Ionic Key Server.

This method makes an HTTP call to Ionic.com to request the creation of an identity assertion by an Ionic Key Server. This assertion is useful for proving that the machine which requested the assertion is in fact a registered device in the Ionic Key Server. The Ionic Key Server which creates the assertion is the one associated with the currently active profile of this agent object (see Agent::ActiveProfile::get()). Throws an SdkException on failure.

Parameters
[in]assertionRequestThe request input data object.
Returns
Returns the response output data object.

◆ CreateKey() [1/6]

CreateKeysResponse IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::CreateKey ( )

Creates a protection key without attributes through Ionic.com.

This method makes an HTTP call to Ionic.com to create protection keys. If the key being requested is denied by the server, an SdkException will be thrown. If any other error occurs, an Exception or an SdkException will be thrown.

In the case of SdkException being thrown, the caller can look at SdkException::ErrorCodeEnum to know the reason for the error.

Returns
A protection key response data object.
See also
Agent::CreateKey(AttributesDictionary^, MetadataDictionary^)
Agent::CreateKey(AttributesDictionary^)
Agent::CreateKey(MetadataDictionary^)
Agent::CreateKeys(CreateKeysRequest^)

Parameters

◆ CreateKeys()

CreateKeysResponse IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::CreateKeys ( CreateKeysRequest ^  agentRequest)

Creates protection keys through Ionic.com.

This method makes an HTTP call to Ionic.com to create protection keys. If any keys being requested are denied by the server, those keys will not exist in the response object. If any error occurs, an Exception or an SdkException will be thrown.

In the case of SdkException being thrown, the caller can look at SdkException::ErrorCodeEnum to know the reason for the error.

This behavior is different than that of Agent::CreateKey() in that it will not throw an exception if a key is denied. That is because in the case of multiple keys being requested, one or more keys being denied should not prevent the caller from getting back the successfully created keys.

NOTE: please limit to 1,000 keys per request, otherwise the server will return an error.

Parameters
[in]agentRequestThe protection key request input data object.
Returns
A protection key response data object.

◆ GetKeys()

GetKeysResponse IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::GetKeys ( GetKeysRequest^  agentRequest)

Gets protection keys from Ionic.com.

Parameters
[in]agentRequestThe protection key request input data object.

This method makes an HTTP call to Ionic.com to get protection keys. If any keys being requested are denied by the server, those keys will not exist in the response object. If any error occurs, an Exception or an SdkException will be thrown.

In the case of SdkException being thrown, the caller can look at SdkException::ErrorCodeEnum to know the reason for the error.

This behavior is different than that of Agent::GetKey() in that it will not throw an exception if a key is denied. That is because in the case of multiple keys being requested, one or more keys being denied should not prevent the caller from getting back the successfully fetched keys.

NOTE: please limit to 1,000 keys per request, otherwise the server will return an error.

Returns
A get key response.
See also
Agent::GetKey(const String^)
Agent::GetKey(const String^, MetadataDictionary^)

◆ GetMetadata() [1/2]

MetadataDictionary IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::GetMetadata ( )

Get all the metadata properties.

This method returns a dictionary of all the metadata properties.

Modifying the returned dictionary does not affect the agent metadata. The agent metadata can only be modified by using one of the setter methods (e.g. Agent::SetMetadata(const String^, const String^)).

See Agent::SetMetadata(const String^, const String^) for information on what metadata properties are.

Returns
A dictionary of all the agent metadata properties.
See also
Agent::GetMetadata(const String^)
Agent::SetMetadata(MetadataDictionary^)
Agent::SetMetadata(const String^, const String^)

Parameters

Returns

◆ Initialize() [1/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::Initialize ( )

Initialize the agent with default configuration and default profile loader.

Initializes the agent with a default configuration object (AgentConfig) and a default profile loader (AgentDeviceProfilePersistorDefault). This is a convenience method that is equivalent to calling Agent::Initialize(AgentConfig^, DeviceProfilePersistor^).

Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

See also
Agent::Initialize(AgentConfig^, DeviceProfilePersistor^)

◆ Initialize() [2/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::Initialize ( AgentConfig^  config)

Initialize the agent with a configuration object and default profile loader.

Parameters
[in]configConfiguration object.

Initializes the agent with a configuration object and a default profile loader (AgentDeviceProfilePersistorDefault). This is a convenience method that is equivalent to calling Agent::Initialize(AgentConfig^, DeviceProfilePersistor^).

Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

See also
Agent::Initialize(AgentConfig^, DeviceProfilePersistor^)

◆ Initialize() [3/6]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::Initialize ( AgentConfig^  config,
DeviceProfilePersistor ^  profileLoader 
)

Initialize the agent with a configuration object and specified profile loader.

Parameters
[in]configConfiguration object.
[in]profileLoaderDevice profile loader object.

Use the specified configuration object to initialize the agent object for use.

The profile loader is used to load device profiles during initialization. It is also possible to initialize the agent without trying to load any profiles by calling one of the Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles() variants.

Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

◆ Initialize() [4/6]

ProfileManager ^  profileManager 
)

Use the specified configuration object to initialize the agent object for use.

The profile loader is used to load device profiles during initialization. It is also possible to initialize the agent without trying to load any profiles by calling one of the Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles() variants.

Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

Agent::Initialize(AgentConfig^, DeviceProfilePersistor^)

◆ InitializeWithoutProfiles() [1/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles ( )

Initialize the agent with default configuration and without loading any profiles.

Initializes the agent with a default configuration object and does not attempt to load any profiles. This is a convenience method that is equivalent to calling Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles(AgentConfig^).

Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

See also
Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles(AgentConfig^)

◆ InitializeWithoutProfiles() [2/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::InitializeWithoutProfiles ( AgentConfig^  config)

Initialize the agent with a configuration object and without loading device profiles.

Parameters
[in]configConfiguration object.

Use the specified configuration object to initialize the agent object for use.

This function will not automatically attempt to load device profiles. You may choose to initialize this way when you intend to provide device profiles manually through the Agent::AddProfile() method or by setting the Agent::AllProfiles field. You can also simply call Agent::LoadProfiles() at a time after initialization.
\ Throws an SdkException if initialization fails.

◆ LoadProfiles() [1/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::LoadProfiles ( )

(DEPRECATED) Load device profiles using the default profile persistor.

Deprecated:
This method is deprecated and has been moved to ProfileManager The time of removal is TBD.

Attempts to load device profiles using the default profile persistor.

This is a convenience function and is equivalent to calling Agent::LoadProfiles(DeviceProfilePersistor^).

Throws and SdkException on error.

See also
Agent::LoadProfiles(DeviceProfilePersistor^)

◆ LoadProfiles() [2/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::LoadProfiles ( DeviceProfilePersistor ^  persistor)

(DEPRECATED) Load device profiles using the specified profile persistor.

Deprecated:
This method is deprecated and has been moved to ProfileManager The time of removal is TBD.
Parameters
[in]persistorThe device profile persistor.

Attempts to load device profiles using the specified profile persistor.

If loading is successful, all existing profiles associated with the agent will be discarded in favor of the newly loaded profiles. The active profile provided by the persistor will replace the previous active profile (if any). It is also possible that the persistor does not provide an active profile, in which case the agent object will be left without an active profile.

If loading is not successful, then no changes are made to the state of the agent.

Throws and SdkException on error.

See also
Agent::LoadProfiles()

◆ SetMetadata() [1/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::SetMetadata ( const String^  mwsName,
const String^  mwsValue 
)

Add / update a metadata property.

Parameters
[in]mwsNameThe name of the metadata property.
[in]mwsValueThe value of the metadata property.

If a metadata property with the same name already exists, it will be overwritten. Otherwise, a new metadata property will be added.

Metadata properties can be set on an Agent object as well as any request object (implementations of AgentRequestBase). These metadata properties are sent along with any network request to the Ionic.com server and are used primarily for the purpose of analytics.

For example, a client can send its application name with every network request (e.g. Agent::GetKeys(), Agent::CreateKeys()) by setting the metadata property Agent::MetaApplicationName on the Agent object used to make the request. The Agent::MetaApplicationName string is a well known constant, but any arbitrary string can be used as the metadata property name.

Metadata properties which are set at the request level (i.e. set on a request object or provided directly to a request call) take precedence over metadata properties that are set at the agent level.

See also
Agent::SetMetadata(MetadataDictionary^)
Agent::GetMetadata(const String^)
Agent::GetMetadata()

◆ SetMetadata() [2/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::SetMetadata ( MetadataDictionary^  dictMetadata)

Set all metadata properties with the provided dictionary.

Parameters
[in]dictMetadataThe metadata properties.

Any existing metadata properties will be lost. The provided metadata dictionary will become the full set of metadata properties on the agent.

See Agent::SetMetadata(const String^, const String^) for information on what metadata properties are.

See also
Agent::SetMetadata(const String^, const String^)
Agent::GetMetadata(const String^)
Agent::GetMetadata()

◆ UpdateProfileFromKNS()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::UpdateProfileFromKNS ( String^  msDeviceId,
String^  knsUrl 
)

Finds the deviceId (or uses the active profile), gets the current KNS information for the profile keyspace, and then updates the profile (and active profile if needed). The user is encouraged to save the profile afterward.

Parameters
[in]msDeviceIdThe device ID of the profile to update, optional, uses active profile by default.
[in]knsUrlThe KNS provider url, optional, defaults to https://api.ionic.com

◆ ActiveProfile

DeviceProfile^ IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::ActiveProfile
get

(DEPRECATED) Get the current device profile of the agent.

Deprecated:
This method is deprecated and has been moved to ProfileManager The time of removal is TBD.
Returns
Returns the active device profile object. If no active profile is set, then the object is unitialized and calling DeviceProfile::IsLoaded() on the object will return false. You can also call Agent::HasActiveProfile() to determine if there is an active profile.
See also
Agent::HasActiveProfile(), AgentDeviceProfile::IsLoaded()

◆ AllProfiles

List< DeviceProfile^>^ IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::AllProfiles
getset

(DEPRECATED) All available device profiles.

Deprecated:
This method is deprecated and has been moved to ProfileManager The time of removal is TBD.

This method discards all previous profiles (if any) and adds all the provided profiles. The previous active profile (if any) will be retained if it exists in the provided profiles.

◆ Config

AgentConfig^ IonicSecurity::SDK::Agent::Config
get

Get the current configuration of the agent.

Configuration cannot be changed directly through this object. Configuration is done through the initialization functions and cannot be changed after the agent is initialized.
